statements: UPDATE tracking_model_versioning SET model_version = 2 WHERE experiment_id = 1;
UPDATE tracking_model_versioning SET experiment_result = '{"accuracy": 0.85}' WHERE experiment_id = 2;
UPDATE tracking_model_versioning SET model_version = 2, experiment_result = '{"accuracy": 0.85, "loss": 0.12}' WHERE experiment_id = 100
UPDATE tracking_model_versioning SET experiment_result = '{"accuracy": 0.78, "loss": 0.15}', model_version = 3 WHERE experiment_id = 200
UPDATE version_tracking SET status='Active' WHERE version_id=1;
UPDATE experiment_results SET result='Success' WHERE experiment_id=10;
UPDATE version_tracking SET status = 'approved' WHERE version_id = 1;
UPDATE experiment_results SET result = 'success', experiment_date = '2022-08-15' WHERE experiment_id = 10;
UPDATE model_versions SET model_name = 'Updated Model Name' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE experiment_results SET result_value = 0.75 WHERE experiment_id = 2;
UPDATE model_versions SET model_name = 'New Model', created_at = '2022-01-15 12:30:00' WHERE id = 5;
UPDATE experiment_results SET result_value = 9.5, created_at = '2022-01-22 08:45:00' WHERE experiment_id = 10;
UPDATE ModelVersions SET version_number = 2, updated_at = '2022-01-15 10:30:00' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Experiments SET started_at = '2022-01-16 08:00:00', ended_at = '2022-01-16 15:30:00' WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE ModelVersions SET version_number = 2, updated_at = '2022-01-15 09:30:00' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE Experiments SET ended_at = '2022-01-10 15:45:00', experiment_type = 'ML' WHERE id = 3;
UPDATE model_versioning SET version_number = 2 WHERE model_name = 'model_A';
UPDATE experiment_results SET result_value = 0.75, experiment_date = '2023-05-15' WHERE experiment_name = 'exp_1';
UPDATE model_versioning SET version_number = 2 WHERE model_name = 'RegressionModel';
UPDATE experiment_results SET experiment_name = 'A/B Test' WHERE result_value > 0.5;
